hostNotes.text:
> Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 20 minutes on resilience.
>
> We’ll be exploring the concept of resourcing followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

> Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. Now, would you like to start?
>
> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.
>
> Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Tap play to start the audio exercise

content.heading: Reflection
content.text: You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own.

How did you experience practising resourcing? 

How did you feel before and after resourcing? 

Did you notice any change?
content.heading: Reflection
How did you experience practising resourcing? How did you feel before and after resourcing? Did you notice any change?

hostNotes.text:
Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own. 

How did you experience practising resourcing? How did you feel before and after resourcing? Did you notice any change?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer. 

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: What did we discover about personal resources?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.heading: What kinds of sensations came when we used our resources?
Where in our bodies did we feel those sensations?
Do you think we could come up with more personal resources?
Would you use a personal resources to help you feel better?

hostNotes.text: Good job. Today, we’ve practised resourcing. Resourcing enables us to develop one or more tools to use when we need to self-regulate our minds and bodies.
If we're up for it, we can continue with a mission: Practice using one of your resources on three different days this week.

Plan the step you will take by considering moments when resourcing might help to bring you calm and clarity. Before we leave this space, let’s do a mini check-out: How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two to three words.

Who would like to start? 

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one. 

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today. 

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text: Well done. Today, we’ve practised resourcing. Resourcing enables us to develop one or more tools to use when we need to self-regulate our minds and bodies.
content.heading: Resilience

content.text:
If we're up for it, we can continue with a mission: Practice using one of your resources on three different days this week. 

Plan the step you will take by considering moments when resourcing might help to bring you calm and clarity.
content.heading: Resilience

en.name: Resourcing

hostNotes.text: > Press play to start the exercise

en.description: Personal resources are internal, external, or imagined things, unique to each person, that bring about a sense of well-being, safety, or happiness when brought to present moment awareness.
